Notes: First day of medication. One significant syncope triggered this. We had to give CPR, she was non responsive for 1-2min.
Four coughs. Usually around eating and activity.
Four coughs. She coughed awake at night once.
Little rest during day. Coughs increase to 8 today.
Mechanical coughs if laying on back, but breathing variation returns.
More active during daytime. Wouldn't rest.
Took to a different vet. Confirms diagnosis, gives shorter prognosis. Increases meds.
New vet recommends counting SRR only at night, not during day.
Wife departs for business. Hazel throws up meds from anxiety, one hour after dose.
Stable despite throwing up meds yesterday.
Coughs have been fewer, but more serious.
Woke to one serious cough. Stopped breathing 15 seconds.
Meds were late since I made the mistake of oversleeping, 1.5 hours. Stayed awake late to make up for it.
Pushed med time down half an hour to let her kidneys balance.
Med time re-established, all normal.
Holiday weekend. She saw her original owners to say goodbye. She seems drowsy.
Seems drowsy.
Much more active. Suddenly very alert and awake.
She can no longer walk longer distances in the house without coughing. She needs to break up trips into short legs of travel.
Her cough worsens. It's oddly dry, but very prolonged.
Her cough worsens. 20 coughs today.
SRR jumps up beyond 30. She is having a visibly more difficult time.
Vet called. We need antitussive meds. Hazel given synthetic opioid Torbugesic because unstable at appointment. No counts, she's sedated.
Counts resume. All OK.
Missed a dose (adjusting to new timing). Started ACE inhibiter.
No count. We started Hydrocodone today, 1 mg. We were told the count would appear irregularly low.
Begins to wake at night to pee.
We increase bedroom temperature night to see if better quality of sleep for her. It does not help.
Moved the timing of the 10 mg of furosemide to 930pm.
Minor syncope. Too much coughing, she was hopping on couches frequently from a guest visit.
Severe coughing before bed.
Coughing hits 10-13 times a day.
Coughing reduces to three or four times.
I missed the 2pm furosemide dose because we had a hospital appointment. I had to wait to drive my wife back.
Stable despite yesterdays missed dose.
Extreme fatigue. She slept most of the day.
Seems her normal self.
Seems her normal self. We got the hydrocodone in pill form, made compound now.
Coughing awake at night. No daytime coughs.
I got held in meetings and could not leave. I missed the 2pm furosemide dose.
Stable again only one day later. Trend seems to be it can go up but resets at night
Mid-day and night doses were late; seems stable
Very low amount of coughs.
Fell asleep. Worked overtime and couldn't stay awake.
Fell asleep. Worked overtime and couldn't stay awake.
Fell asleep. Worked overtime and couldn't stay awake.
Diarrhea. Woke at 4am and 7am, then two more bowel movements in the day.
Diarrhea continues.
Hardly slept during the day. Seems anxious.
Diarrhea not improving and fortiflora not helping.
Fell asleep. Worked overtime and couldn't stay awake.
Diarrhea continuing but slowly solidifying. Bowel movements are slowing.
Diarrhea darkens and vet is contacted about tylosin.
No tylosin, but probiotic (Proviable) is given.
Only one bowel movement and it seems solid.
Diarrhea seems to be gone.
Sarah home from Toronto and Hazel coughs more in excitement.
Coughs during the day seem to increase.
Went to vet because she has been increasingly crying and hiding. Seems in pain. Wouldnt eat or settle. No issues found, imaging okay.
She's eating again, but she's still not her normal self. She seems uncomfortable despite clear bill of health.
Caught her hiding upstairs. Final count was not in deep rest.
She gets probiotic; proviable. 2ml. Only two rounds of diarrhea, 5am and 8am, but seems constipated now.
Her diarrhea returns in a minor episode, but probiotic seems to work and she only has two bowel movements.
Fell asleep, failed to get the final two counts. Worked overtime and couldn't stay awake.
Measurements were taken when she wasn't in a state of deep rest.
She didn't take her morning meds. She tasted the hydrocodone and rejected it. Absorbed maybe 20% of hydrocodone and furosemide in morning.
Her evening dose was mixed up: 7pm was all and final, accidentally including furosemide. 9pm furosemide never happened.
She had a minor presyncope in the morning. Vasodilation from meds.
Christmas - we don't leave her alone long (2hr).
Christmas - she's anxious, we don't leave her alone long (4hr). No issues.
Switched to chicken for pill delivery. Tiny steak bites might have been causing fat related colitis flare ups.
Stopped hydrocodone. We're using chicken for pill delivery, harder to deliver in chicken. She can find it and denies it.
She seems better without hydrocodone. More herself, less bothered and lethargic. She has appetite, and didn't cough.
Stomach normal.
Stomach normal. She had three bowel movements, the final stool was getting soft again. Will monitor tomorrow.
We stay home with her to spend new years eve together.
Day 98
Diarrhea back in the evening. We start the probiotic paste again tomorrow.
She has a cough again, but unknown if mechanical or not yet. Day 100.
Diarrhea and coughs improve.
Stomach is back to normal.
Big snow melt, she starts to explore the yard more. Slowly, no running. She hasnt walked this far since day 1.
We fell asleep, we had been waking earlier for work and couldn't stay awake.
We find one old and dried up 10 mg furosemide on the couch. Must have fallen out of chicken pocket. We have no clue how old it is, but it's dry and we think old.

We expand her harness, she's now 6.3 kg when she used to be 5.8 kg. We underfeed and use expensive low-fat diet, but without walks the weight is slowly adding. She still wears it well, but its slightly noticeable and required adjusting her harness.
Coughs are returning, and they aren't mechanical. She's laying on her stomach when they start.
First elevated breathing spike. We took several counts, it was consistent in deep and light sleep. Monitoring for changes to meds.
Found some furosemide in her chair. We think maybe she didn't take the full dose and hid it.
We comb the eating area after her meds, not just monitoring visually now. She bounces back to stable after the recent uptick in missed dose.
Fell asleep on the last count, we were tired from overtime.
We get a vet followup for her blood; it's doing well. No signs of medication problems. A new arrythmia is detected. New prognosis is 6-9 months.
Her stomach has been improving on the new prebiotic, not just probiotic.
We go to the groomer with the vets approval. She's stable to travel for short trips. She doesn't cough the entire time.
She fell roughly 4 feet. We dont know if lost footing, or if she passed out.
Her tail won't go up, and she seems sore. We suspect cold tail/sacrum nerve pain.
She starts pain medication, two daily gabapentin doses of 50mg for 7 days.
Her diarrhea returns from the gabapentin. Her tail won't go up so we start bathing her after each bowel movement.
